description_txt: stated on April 14, 2013 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: The "working tax cut" created "over 40,000 new jobs in just the last four years."

description_txt: stated on March 12, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: The decision to remove Chick-fil-A from Emory University was based solely on student feedback.

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2013 in a speech from the White House Rose Garden:
quote_txt: A bipartisan background check amendment "outlawed any (gun) registry.  Plain and simple, right there in the text."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2013 in a statement:
quote_txt: The Manchin-Toomey amendment "would have criminalized certain private transfers of firearms between honest citizens, requiring lifelong friends, neighbors and some family members" to get government approval.

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2013 in remarks in the White House Rose Garden:
quote_txt: "The NRA used to support expanded background checks."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2013 in an op-ed in the "New York Times":
quote_txt: Polls show that Americans "overwhelmingly" support "expanding background checks."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2013 in a letter to a constituent:
quote_txt: "Well over 90 percent of felony cases, all over the nation, are committed by defendants who grew up in father-absent households."

description_txt: stated on April 9, 2013 in a Senate Education Committee meeting.:
quote_txt: Says Texas ranks 49th nationally in "what we are doing to support our per-pupil investment in education in the state."

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2013 in a tweet promoting Equal Pay Day:
quote_txt: "Women make 77 cents for every dollar earned by men."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • April 18, 2013

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2013 in an interview on ABC's 'This Week':
quote_txt: Ché Guevara "wrote extensively about the superiority of white Europeans over people of African descent."

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2013 in in an appearance on Mark Davis’ KSKY-AM radio show:
quote_txt: Says Texas "school systems" lose 45 days a year on testing.

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2013 in an interview on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: The immigration proposal from the Gang of Eight "is not amnesty."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2013 in an interview with Central Florida News 13:
quote_txt: "Rick Scott has paid down our debt by about $2 billion. Charlie Crist’s debt went up about $5 billion."

description_txt: stated on April 9, 2013 in a web posting:
quote_txt: "Gov. Scott Walker (is) more than halfway to (his) 250,000 jobs goal."

description_txt: stated on April 1, 2013 in a Texas Capitol press conference.:
quote_txt: Says uncompensated health care costs absorbed by Texas hospitals are adding $1,800 a year to Texas private insurance rates.

description_txt: stated on April 12, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: "We Really Do Have the Highest Corporate Tax Rate in the World."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2013 in comments on ABC's "This Week with George Stephanopoulos":
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama "has allowed, each year he's been here, the prosecutions of gun cases (for background check failures) to go down. ... They've declined every year since President Bush left office."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2013 in an email to supporters:
quote_txt: Says a gun bill before the Senate would make it a federal felony to "leave town for more than seven days, and leave someone else at home with your firearms."

description_txt: stated on April 9, 2013 in a committee hearing on SB 1636:
quote_txt: "In 2010 alone, 1,270 infants were reported to have died following attempted abortions and notably that is only one year."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2013 in Texas House debate on state budget.:
quote_txt: Says Texas lawmakers in 2011 ordered school districts to test every student on their respiratory system and weight.

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: A proposed bill in the Florida Legislature "would authorize the public hoarding of cats by feral cat activists."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2013 in an email to supporters:
quote_txt: Says a gun bill before the Senate "is proposing the universal registration of all firearms and their owners."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2013 in a House floor speech.:
quote_txt: Says "a pack-a-day smoker who quits because of the tax increase will save about $1,650 a year."

description_txt: stated on April 3, 2013 in a statement.:
quote_txt: Under Obamacare, Virginia taxpayers would have been "forced to pay for abortions" if the General Assembly had not recently intervened.

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2013 in a Texas House floor debate.:
quote_txt: Says Texas state funds were spent on "a TV series on spouses cheating on their wives, kind of glorifying the act of cheating."

description_txt: stated on April 9, 2013 in remarks at Politico breakfastt:
quote_txt: "The Social Security disability fund is going belly up in 2016."

description_txt: stated on April 3, 2013 in a column:
quote_txt: Wisconsin education agency "urged white students to wear white wristbands ‘as a reminder about your (white) privilege.’ "

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2013 in a statement.:
quote_txt: Abortion coverage is a standard insurance benefit "in nearly 90 percent of private plans sold in the U.S."

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2013 in a Twitter post:
quote_txt: The Internal Revenue Service spent $60,000 on a "Star Trek" training video.

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2013 in a video posted on YouTube:
quote_txt: "In Rhode Island, 28 percent of adults released from state prisons are re-incarcerated within a year."
